title: 旧约 - 传道书(Ecclesiastes) - 第 4 章
subTitle: 旧约 -- 传道书(Ecclesiastes) -- 第 4 章 ( 本篇共有 12 章 )

lineList.en: So I returned, and considered all the oppressions that are done under the sun: and behold the tears of such as were oppressed, and they had no comforter; and on the side of their oppressors there was power; but they had no comforter.
lineList.cn: 我又转念，见日光之下所行的一切欺压。看哪，受欺压的流泪，且无人安慰。欺压他们的有势力，也无人安慰他们。

lineList.en: Wherefore I praised the dead which are already dead more than the living which are yet alive.
lineList.cn: 因此，我赞叹那早已死的死人，胜过那还活着的活人。

lineList.en: Yea, better is he than both they, which hath not yet been, who hath not seen the evil work that is done under the sun.
lineList.cn: 并且我以为那未曾生的，就是未见过日光之下恶事的，比这两等人更强。

lineList.en: Again, I considered all travail, and every right work, that for this a man is envied of his neighbour. This is also vanity and vexation of spirit.
lineList.cn: 我又见人为一切的劳碌，和各样灵巧的工作，就被邻舍嫉妒。这也是虚空，也是捕风。

lineList.en: The fool foldeth his hands together, and eateth his own flesh.
lineList.cn: 愚昧人抱着手，吃自己的肉。

lineList.en: Better is an handful with quietness, than both the hands full with travail and vexation of spirit.
lineList.cn: 满了一把，得享安静，强如满了两把，劳碌捕风。

lineList.en: Then I returned, and I saw vanity under the sun.
lineList.cn: 我又转念，见日光之下有一件虚空的事。

lineList.en: There is one alone, and there is not a second; yea, he hath neither child nor brother: yet is there no end of all his labour; neither is his eye satisfied with riches; neither saith he, For whom do I labour, and bereave my soul of good? This is also vanity, yea, it is a sore travail.
lineList.cn: 有人孤单无二，无子，无兄，竟劳碌不息，眼目也不以钱财为足。（他说）我劳劳碌碌，刻苦自己，不享福乐，到底是为谁呢。这也是虚空，是极重的劳苦。

lineList.en: Two are better than one; because they have a good reward for their labour.
lineList.cn: 两个人总比一个人好，因为二人劳碌同得美好的果效。

lineList.en: For if they fall, the one will lift up his fellow: but woe to him that is alone when he falleth; for he hath not another to help him up.
lineList.cn: 若是跌倒，这人可以扶起他的同伴。若是孤身跌倒，没有别人扶起他来。这人就有祸了。

lineList.en: Again, if two lie together, then they have heat: but how can one be warm alone?
lineList.cn: 再者，二人同睡，就都暖和。一人独睡，怎能暖和呢。

lineList.en: And if one prevail against him, two shall withstand him; and a threefold cord is not quickly broken.
lineList.cn: 有人功胜孤身一人，若有二人便能敌挡他。三股合成的绳子，不容易折断。

lineList.en: Better is a poor and a wise child than an old and foolish king, who will no more be admonished.
lineList.cn: 贫穷而有智慧的少年人，胜过年老不肯纳谏的愚昧王。

lineList.en: For out of prison he cometh to reign; whereas also he that is born in his kingdom becometh poor.
lineList.cn: 这人是从监牢中出来作王。在他国中，生来原是贫穷的。

lineList.en: I considered all the living which walk under the sun, with the second child that shall stand up in his stead.
lineList.cn: 我见日光之下一切行动的活人，都随从那第二位，就是起来替老王的少年人。

lineList.en: There is no end of all the people, even of all that have been before them: they also that come after shall not rejoice in him. Surely this also is vanity and vexation of spirit.
lineList.cn: 他所治理的众人，就是他的百姓，多得无数。在他后来的人，尚且不喜悦他。这是虚空，也是捕风。
